hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu Hurairah: No one of you should prevent his neighbor from driving a wooden peg into his wall, for that is a right obligatory upon him. Also written on the gate of Paradise: Charity is rewarded with ten times its value, and loans with eighteen times.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu Ubaidah from Jabir ibn Zayd from Abu Hurairah from the Prophet ﷺ: A Muslim eats in one stomach, while a disbeliever eats in seven stomachs.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu Ubaidah from Jabir ibn Zayd: The Prophet ﷺ hosted a guest and ordered that sheep be milked for him. He drank the milk of one sheep, then another, until he drank the milk of seven sheep. Then in the morning he accepted Islam. The Prophet ﷺ then ordered that sheep be milked for him, he drank the milk of one, then another but did not finish it. So the Prophet ﷺ said: Verily the believer eats in one stomach while the disbeliever eats in seven stomachs.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu Ubaidah from Jabir ibn Zayd who said he heard from the Prophet ﷺ: When a fly falls in the vessel of one of you, immerse it completely, for in one of its wings is sickness and in the other is cure, and it brings forward the sickness and delays the cure.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu Ubaidah from Jabir ibn Zayd: Information reached me that Abu Said al-Khudri entered upon Marwan ibn al-Hakam, so Marwan said to him: Did you hear the Prophet ﷺ forbid breathing in drink? Abu Said said: Yes, and the Prophet ﷺ said: If you cannot satisfy yourself with one breath, remove the cup from your mouth then breathe. The man said: But I see sediment in it. The Prophet ﷺ said: Pour it out.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu Ubaidah from Jabir ibn Zayd: Information reached me from the Prophet ﷺ that he was brought a drink and drank from it. On his right was a young boy, and on his left were elderly companions. The Prophet ﷺ asked the boy: Do you permit me to give this to these elders? The boy said: No, by Allah, and I do not prefer anyone over you for myself. So the Prophet ﷺ placed it in the boy's hands.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu Ubaidah from Jabir ibn Zayd from Aisha: We presented haysa (a food preparation) to the Prophet ﷺ. [Also reported:] Abu Ubaidah from Jabir ibn Zayd said: Ibn al-Nu'man said: We departed with the Prophet ﷺ until we were at as-Sahba, which is from the nearest part of Khaybar. He prayed Asr and called for provisions, but nothing was brought except saweeq. He ordered it to be kneaded, and he ate and we ate. Then he stood for Maghrib, and we rinsed our mouths and he rinsed his mouth, then he prayed and did not perform ablution.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu Ubaidah from Jabir ibn Zayd: Information reached me from Jabir ibn Abdullah who said: The Prophet ﷺ sent forth an expedition and appointed Abu Ubaidah ibn al-Jarrah as our commander, and there were three hundred of us, and I was among them. We departed until when we were on the way, the provisions were exhausted. Abu Ubaidah ordered that the provisions of the army be gathered, and there were two leather bags of dates. He rationed for us each day little by little until it was exhausted, and we only received dates one by one. When they were exhausted, we reached the sea and found a large fish like a mountain. The army ate from it for eighteen nights. Then Abu Ubaidah ordered two of its ribs to be set up, and he ordered his camel to be saddled, then he passed under them without touching them. Abu Ubaidah said: The Prophet ﷺ forbade three types of eating: peeling, taking handfuls of large amounts, and digging. The peeler is one who eats from every side and strips the surface of the food. The one who takes large handfuls is the one who takes mouthfuls beyond capacity. The digger is one who digs in the food and returns to the sauce.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu Ubaidah from Jabir ibn Zayd from Ibn Abbas from the Prophet ﷺ: He forbade drinking while standing. It is also reported that he drank from Zamzam while standing. Ibn Abbas said: The reference in this matter is to the Book of Allah, in His saying: Eat and drink (Quran 7:31), so this verse permits eating and drinking in any manner except in places where the Prophet ﷺ specifically forbade it.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu Ubaidah from Jabir ibn Zayd from Ibn Abbas: Khalid ibn al-Walid said: I entered upon the Prophet ﷺ in the house of Maymunah. He was brought roasted lizard (dabb). The Prophet ﷺ reached out his hand to it, but some of the women in the house said: Inform the Prophet ﷺ what he wants to eat. It was said: It is lizard, O Prophet of Allah. He withdrew his hand. Khalid said: I asked: Is it forbidden, O Prophet of Allah? He said: No, but it is not found in the land of my people, so I find myself averse to it. Khalid said: So I pulled it and ate it while the Prophet ﷺ watched.

potential_issues.issue: Mixed transmission terms: عَنْ and قَالَ

Topics: Incident of roasted lizard offered to the Prophet ﷺ
Permissibility of eating lizard meat
Prophet ﷺ refusing lizard due to personal dislike rather than prohibition
Khalid ibn al-Walid eating the lizard

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu Ubaidah from Jabir: Information reached me from Ibn Umar who said: A man came to the Prophet ﷺ and asked: What do you say about lizard, O Prophet of Allah? He said: I am not eating it nor do I forbid it.

narrators.name: Abu Ubaidah

chainIssues: Transmission uses بَلَغَنِي (information reached me) - indicates mursal chain

potential_issues.issue: The hadith uses بَلَغَنِي (information reached me) indicating a mursal chain with missing narrators
potential_issues.impact: This is a mursal hadith with broken chain of transmission

potential_issues.issue: Abu Ubaidah is classified as a weak narrator
potential_issues.impact: The weak status of Abu Ubaidah combined with mursal transmission further weakens this hadith.

hadiths.IISGrade: Disconnections But All Narrators Are Ok
Topics: Question about the permissibility of eating lizard

Optional nature of eating lizard in Islamic law
